intro: Artanthe aequirophylla, commonly known as the narrowleaf artanthe, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a silvery or grayish hue, and its flowers are usually pink or purple. Artanthe aequirophylla is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
